Description: Fungal infection is a common skin condition caused by fungi.
Elaborated Description: Fungal infections are caused by fungi that invade the skin, nails, or scalp. They often result in redness, itching, and peeling. Common types include athlete's foot and ringworm.

Description: Allergy is an immune system reaction to a substance in the environment.
Elaborated Description: Allergies occur when the immune system reacts to harmless substances. Symptoms may include sneezing, rashes, or difficulty breathing. Common allergens include pollen, dust, and certain foods.

Description: GERD (Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease) is a digestive disorder that affects the lower esophageal sphincter.
Elaborated Description: GERD is a digestive disorder caused by acid reflux. It leads to heartburn and discomfort in the chest. Long-term GERD can damage the esophagus.

Description: Chronic cholestasis is a condition where bile flow from the liver is reduced for a prolonged period.
Elaborated Description: Chronic cholestasis is a condition where bile flow from the liver is reduced or blocked. It may cause jaundice, itching, and dark urine. It often signals liver or bile duct issues.

Description: Drug Reaction occurs when the body reacts adversely to a medication.
Elaborated Description: Drug reactions occur when the body responds negatively to medications. Symptoms range from mild rashes to severe allergic responses. Immediate medical attention is sometimes necessary.

Description: Peptic ulcer disease involves sores that develop on the inner lining of the stomach and small intestine.
Elaborated Description: Peptic ulcers are sores that form in the stomach lining. They are often caused by H. pylori infection or long-term NSAID use. Common symptoms include stomach pain and bloating.

Description: AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome) is a disease caused by HIV that weakens the immune system.
Elaborated Description: AIDS is the final stage of HIV infection. It severely weakens the immune system, increasing vulnerability to infections. There is no cure, but antiretroviral therapy can manage symptoms.

Description: Diabetes is a chronic condition that affects how the body processes blood sugar.
Elaborated Description: Diabetes is a chronic condition that affects blood sugar regulation. It results from insulin resistance or lack of insulin. Uncontrolled diabetes can lead to serious health issues.

Description: Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of the stomach and intestines, typically caused by a virus or bacteria.
Elaborated Description: Gastroenteritis is the inflammation of the stomach and intestines. It often causes diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal cramps. It is usually viral or bacterial in origin.

Description: Bronchial Asthma is a respiratory condition characterized by inflammation of the airways.
Elaborated Description: Asthma is a respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and narrowing. Symptoms include wheezing, coughing, and breathlessness. It can be triggered by allergens, cold air, or exercise.

Description: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a common cardiovascular condition.
Elaborated Description: Hypertension is consistently high blood pressure. It increases the risk of heart disease and stroke. Lifestyle changes and medication help control it.

Description: Migraine is a type of headache that often involves severe pain and sensitivity to light and sound.
Elaborated Description: Migraines are intense headaches often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light. They can last from hours to days. Triggers include stress, food, and hormonal changes.

Description: Cervical spondylosis is a degenerative condition of the cervical spine.
Elaborated Description: Cervical spondylosis is age-related wear and tear of the neck vertebrae. It may lead to neck pain and stiffness. Severe cases can compress spinal nerves.

Description: Paralysis (brain hemorrhage) refers to the loss of muscle function due to bleeding in the brain.
Elaborated Description: Paralysis from brain hemorrhage occurs due to bleeding in the brain that damages nerves. It can cause partial or full loss of movement. Emergency care is crucial.

Description: Jaundice is a yellow discoloration of the skin and eyes, often indicating liver problems.
Elaborated Description: Jaundice is the yellowing of skin and eyes due to high bilirubin levels. It indicates liver dysfunction or bile duct blockage. It often accompanies other liver-related diseases.

Description: Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease affecting humans and other animals.
Elaborated Description: Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease. It causes fever, chills, and flu-like symptoms. Prompt treatment is vital to prevent complications.

Description: Chicken pox is a highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy rash.
Elaborated Description: Chickenpox is a contagious viral infection characterized by itchy skin rashes and blisters. It mainly affects children. Vaccination prevents its spread.

Description: Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms.
Elaborated Description: Dengue is a viral infection spread by mosquitoes. Symptoms include high fever, rash, and muscle pain. Severe cases may lead to bleeding and organ failure.

Description: Typhoid is a bacterial infection that can lead to a high fever and gastrointestinal symptoms.
Elaborated Description: Typhoid is a bacterial infection transmitted through contaminated food and water. It causes high fever, weakness, and abdominal pain. Antibiotics are the primary treatment.

Description: hepatitis A is a viral liver disease.
Elaborated Description: Hepatitis A is a liver infection caused by consuming contaminated food or water. It usually resolves on its own. Vaccination offers prevention.

Description: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver.
Elaborated Description: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver and can become chronic. It spreads through blood and body fluids. Vaccination is highly effective.

Description: Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation.
Elaborated Description: Hepatitis C is a liver disease caused by the hepatitis C virus. It spreads through blood contact. It often becomes chronic and requires antiviral therapy.

Description: Hepatitis D is a serious liver disease caused by the hepatitis D virus.
Elaborated Description: Hepatitis D is a liver infection that only occurs in people with Hepatitis B. It worsens liver damage. Co-infection increases disease severity.

Description: Hepatitis E is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation.
Elaborated Description: Hepatitis E spreads through contaminated water. It causes liver inflammation and jaundice. It usually resolves on its own, but can be serious in pregnant women.

Description: Alcoholic hepatitis is inflammation of the liver due to alcohol consumption.
Elaborated Description: Alcoholic hepatitis is liver inflammation caused by excessive alcohol intake. Symptoms include jaundice, nausea, and abdominal pain. Continued alcohol use can lead to liver failure.

Description: Tuberculosis is a bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs.
Elaborated Description: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection affecting the lungs. It spreads through air droplets. It requires long-term antibiotic treatment.

Description: Common Cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract.
Elaborated Description: Common cold is a viral upper respiratory tract infection. Symptoms include sneezing, sore throat, and runny nose. It usually resolves in a few days.

Description: Pneumonia is an inflammatory condition affecting the air sacs in the lungs.
Elaborated Description: Pneumonia is a lung infection that causes inflammation in the air sacs. It leads to cough, fever, and difficulty breathing. Bacterial pneumonia requires antibiotics.

Description: Dimorphic hemmorhoids(piles) is a condition characterized by swollen blood vessels in the rectum.
Elaborated Description: Hemorrhoids are swollen veins in the rectum or anus. They cause discomfort, itching, and bleeding. Treatment includes dietary changes and topical medications.

Description: Heart attack is a sudden and severe reduction in blood flow to the heart muscle.
Elaborated Description: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked. It causes chest pain, breathlessness, and can be fatal. Immediate medical help is crucial.

Description: Varicose veins are enlarged, twisted veins that usually appear on the legs.
Elaborated Description: Varicose veins are enlarged, twisted veins usually in the legs. They occur due to weak or damaged vein walls. Symptoms include pain, swelling, and heaviness.

Description: Hypothyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.
Elaborated Description: Hypothyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland underproduces hormones. Symptoms include fatigue, weight gain, and depression. It is treated with hormone replacement therapy.

Description: Hyperthyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone.
Elaborated Description: Hyperthyroidism is caused by overactive thyroid hormone production. Symptoms include weight loss, irritability, and palpitations. Antithyroid drugs or surgery may be needed.

Description: Hypoglycemia is a condition characterized by abnormally low blood sugar levels.
Elaborated Description: Hypoglycemia is abnormally low blood sugar levels. Symptoms include shaking, confusion, and sweating. It requires immediate intake of sugar or carbs.

Description: Osteoarthristis is a degenerative joint disease that affects the cartilage in joints.
Elaborated Description: Osteoarthritis is a degenerative joint disease causing pain and stiffness. It results from cartilage breakdown. It commonly affects knees, hips, and hands.

Description: Arthritis is inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness.
Elaborated Description: Arthritis involves inflammation of one or more joints. It leads to pain, swelling, and reduced motion. Types include rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis.

Description: (Vertigo) Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo is a type of dizziness caused by specific head movements.
Elaborated Description: This is a condition causing sudden spinning sensation due to changes in head position. It is caused by inner ear issues. It can be managed through specific exercises.

Description: Acne is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
Elaborated Description: Acne is a skin condition caused by clogged pores, excess oil, and bacteria. It appears as pimples, blackheads, or cysts. Hormonal changes and diet can contribute.

Description: Urinary tract infection is an infection in any part of the urinary system.
Elaborated Description: UTIs are infections in the urinary system, often caused by bacteria. Symptoms include burning sensation while urinating and frequent urges. Antibiotics are used for treatment.

Description: Psoriasis is a chronic skin condition characterized by red, itchy, and scaly patches.
Elaborated Description: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune skin disorder. It causes red, scaly patches on the skin. Triggers include stress, infections, and weather changes.

Description: Impetigo is a highly contagious skin infection causing red sores that can break open.
Elaborated Description: Impetigo is a contagious skin infection common in children. It causes red sores that rupture and form honey-colored crusts. It is treated with topical or oral antibiotics.
